description.narrative:
Diakonia, en av Sidas ramorganisationer, har till Sida inkommit med en ansökan om att Sida, tillsammans med fem givare, bidrar till insatsen " Common Gender Fund and its Strategic Plan 2019-2023" i Burkina Faso 2019-2023. Insatsen syftar till att bidra att stärka kvinnors och flickors sociala, ekonomiska, politiska rättigheter genom diverse åtgärder för att på så sätt minska ojämställdhet mellan könen på nationell nivå. Sida har tidigare bidragit med stöd till Common Gender Fund under perioden 2012-2014 och 2016-2018.
Diakonia kommer att genomföra stödet tillsammans med lokala icke-statliga organisationer och myndigheter. Insatsens totala budget är 89 miljoner kronor, varav Sida bidrar med 15 miljoner kronor. Övriga givare (Danmark, Schweiz, UNFPA, UNICEF) kommer att bidra med cirka 27 miljoner kronor. Cirka 73 procent av budgeten kommer att vidareförmedlas till tredje part.

Diakonia, one of Sida's framework organizations, has submitted an application to Sida to jointly finance the intervention "the Common Gender Fund and its Strategic Plan 2019-2023” together with four other donors during the period 2019-2023. The intervention aims to contribute to the implementation of relevant and effective actions to strengthen women's and girls' social, economic, political rights through actions to promote the abandonment of GBV, promotion of economic and political empowerment, strengthening gender mainstreaming, involvement of women and youth in the management of security issues, in order to to reduce gender inequalities at the national level. Sida has previously contributed to the Common Gender Fund in 2012-2014 and 2016-2018.
Diakonia will implement the intervention together with local CSOs and Government authorities. The total budget is 89 Million SEK out of which Sida will contribute with 15 million SEK. Other donors (Denmark, Switzerland, UNFPA, UNICEF) will contribute with approximately 27 million SEK. Approximately 73 % of the intervention budget will be forwarded from Diakonia to third parties.

5.1 - End all forms of discrimination against all women and girls everywhere.
5.2 - Avskaffa alla former av våld mot alla kvinnor och flickor i det offentliga och privata rummet, inklusive människohandel, sexuellt utnyttjande och andra typer av exploatering.
5.2 - Eliminate all forms of violence against all women and girls in the public and private spheres, including trafficking and sexual and other types of exploitation.

5.4 - Erkänna och värdesätta obetalt omsorgs- och hushållsarbete genom att tillhandahålla offentliga tjänster, infrastruktur och socialt skydd samt genom att främja delat ansvar inom hushållet och familjen, i enlighet med vad som är nationellt lämpligt.

5.4 - Recognize and value unpaid care and domestic work through the provision of public services, infrastructure and social protection policies and the promotion of shared responsibility within the household and the family as nationally appropriate.
5.5 - Ensure women’s full and effective participation and equal opportunities for leadership at all levels of decision-making in political, economic and public life.
5.5 - Tillförsäkra kvinnor fullt och faktiskt deltagande och lika möjligheter till ledarskap på alla beslutsnivåer i det politiska, ekonomiska och offentliga livet.

5.a - Genomföra reformer för att ge kvinnor lika rätt till ekonomiska resurser, möjlighet att äga och kontrollera mark och andra former av egendom samt tillgång till finansiella tjänster, arv och naturresurser, i enlighet med nationell lagstiftning

5.a - Undertake reforms to give women equal rights to economic resources, as well as access to ownership and control over land and other forms of property, financial services, inheritance and natural resources, in accordance with national laws.
5.c - Adopt and strengthen sound policies and enforceable legislation for the promotion of gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls at all levels.
5.c - Anta och stärka välgrundad politik och genomförbar lagstiftning för att främja jämställdhet och öka alla kvinnors och flickors egenmakt på alla nivåer

description.narrative:
The information below is drawn from the semi-annual rapport and the steering committee meeting which was held in January 2022.
Axis 1: Strengthening actions to promote the abandonment of gender based violence (GBV)
In order to highlight GBV in the partner's area of intervention, radio programs, commercials, theatrical activities and awareness-raising activities were carried out. The radio programs and commercials against GBV had a potential audience of 90,000 people. To ensure the sustainability of these activities, the traditional leaders were involved. At the end of the sessions, the traditional chiefs of the 14 villages of the intervention commune made a commitment to prohibit the practice of excision, to reduce the amount of the dowry required, to prohibit forced marriage, to prohibit early marriage, to prohibit the withdrawal of girls from school and to promote dialogue within families.
Axis 2: Economic and political empowerment of women and youth
To enable women and youth to have the means to exercise their citizenship effectively, Diakonias implementing partner UAOD provided 4208 vulnerable people with National Identity Cards. Also, 800 other people from 8 regions took part in regional forums on women's and young people's citizenship participation. The forums allowed for an assessment of women's participation in the legislative elections of November 22, 2020 and to discuss the role and contribution of women and youth in the fight against security and health challenges, as well as their contributions in the ongoing reform and reconciliation process.
Axis 3: Strengthening the transversality of gender in the elaboration and monitoring of public policies, projects and programs
A gender index has been put in place to measure the level of consideration given to gender in public policies. The index will be produced annually by CIFOEB. For 2021, the data collected from the structures concerned has resulted in a gender index value of 39.47 out of 100, which reflects a low level of gender mainstreaming in public policies, particularly in the social, economic and political spheres.
Axis 4: Involvement of women and youth in the management of security issues
In order to raise the awareness of the population on the importance of involving women and girls in conflict prevention and resolution, the CGD has organized sessions on UN Security Council resolutions 1325/2242/2250. Information-sessions on the mission of the security and defence forces as well as the collaboration between citizens and the security and defence forces has also been organized. Awareness-raising and training sessions have also been organized around radicalization and social cohesion. Lastly, an incubator of twenty-four young women and girls experts on issues related to security sector reform and governance was set up in the zone of intervention.
Axis 5: Coordination, monitoring, evaluation, capitalization of achievements and promotion of innovative approaches
A training-sessions aimed at strengthening the partner organizations knowledge of gender budgeting to enable them to apply it in their projects, programs and strategic plans. It was facilitated by an expert who leads the national process of gender responsive budgeting and children's rights. The following modules were covered: gender and related concepts; GRB and issues; gender budgeting, planning and diagnostic tools; budget process and gender entry points/interest; and gender review of budget documents.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
